JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , ORG , is a company registered in GPE . It was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON of “ Lawyers for Human Rights ” , a non - governmental organisation based in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .

CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows . On DATE the applicant company concluded a contract with Comgaz - Plus ( “ C - P ” ) , a ORG - owned company . In accordance with the contract , the applicant company undertook to produce and install several natural gas heaters and thermal energy distribution systems for the GPE . Having fulfilled its part of the contract , the applicant company asked ORG to pay the equivalent of CARDINAL GPE ( ORG ) in accordance with the contract . C - P failed to pay .

CARDINAL . NORP By further agreements the parties agreed that the applicant company would produce and install several additional natural gas heating systems . CP again failed to pay , but on DATE it concluded a new agreement with the applicant company , under which it undertook to pay the latter the outstanding amount ( USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) within DATE . The parties also agreed that if the amount remained unpaid for DATE , the applicant company would have the right to claim the entire debt plus the damages accrued under the previous agreements , that is , ORG CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . Since C - P again failed to pay , on DATE the applicant company initiated court proceedings , claiming the equivalent of ORG CARDINAL . In its court action , the applicant company indicated that it was in a very poor financial situation , having no money in its bank account after the partial payment of the court fees , as borne out by the bank statement it submitted in the proceedings . It asked for an extension of the time - limit for paying the remainder .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided not to examine the court action on account of the applicant company 's failure to pay the court fees ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) in full . It gave the applicant company DATE to pay in full . On DATE the same court extended the time - limit for payment of the court fees until DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant company appealed , referring to its poor financial situation . It argued that LAW would be violated if the courts refused to examine its case because it had no means to pay the court fees .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal , finding that the applicant company had failed to pay the court fees in full . In reply to the complaint under LAW , the court stated that the lower court “ had had the power to take into account the applicant company 's request to pay the court fee in instalments on the ground of its poor financial situation and to order an extension of the time - limit for paying the court fee which had been set on DATE ” . There was therefore no violation of the applicant company 's right of access to a court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG returned the applicant company 's court action without examining it on account of its failure to pay the court fees in full . The applicant company did not challenge that decision before ORG .
